page.title: 12Places of worship
page.content: {Normanton}has a{Wesleyan chapel still in use, and a{parish church.}The chapel dates from 1822. The parish church,{St. Matthew's,}has a Norman tower, which was crumbling and has been made safe by removing the top section. The church services are held on a Sunday by the Vicar from Sutton, and by special arrangements at other times. { Weston parish church}is{All Saints', has a spire, and dates back to circa. 1100 with additions through the years. Some very old yew trees in the grounds indicate the past need for protection by bow and arrow (This is a common find in older churchyards.) The belfry is unsafe and so the bells are never rung. The Vicar of Tuxford holds the services here with a similar agreement to Normanton. The original{chapel}at Weston is now a private home.
